alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Menifee; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Morgan, Bath, Menifee, southeastern Fleming, southern Rowan and southwestern Elliott Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hamm to near Scranton to Bourbon Furnace. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Scranton, Craney, Yale, Bangor, Zilpo, Pelfrey, Crix and Lick Fork around 850 PM EDT. Big Woods, Blairs Mills, Leisure, Blaze, Paragon and Moore`s Ferry around 855 PM EDT. Wellington, Dan, Korea and Denniston around 900 PM EDT. Ebon, Wrigley, Artville and Midland around 905 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Kellacey, Zag, Ezel, Cornwell, Henry, Omer, Twentysix, Woodsbend, Dehart, Pekin, Licking River, Lick Branch, Yocum and Rothwell. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 118 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Menifee; Morgan; Rowan
